newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft sues computer vendor, charging piracy.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft sues computer vendor, charging piracy.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. said Wednesday it sued an Omaha, Neb., computer vendor, contending the company sold unauthorised copies of its Windows 95, Windows NT and Office software.
The lawsuit, filed in U.S. District Court in Omaha, names 21st Century Solutions Inc. and owner Suchindran Chatterjee as defendants.
Chatterjee could not be reached for immediate comment.

Microsoft said it launched an investigation after a tip from employees of Premier Health Associates in West Des Moines, Iowa, who bought computers from 21st Century Soutions and then allegedly discovered they were loaded with unlicensed software.
Premier has filed a separate lawsuit against the reseller in Iowa state court.
Microsoft officials say they are seeing an increase in piracy of the company's high-end Windows NT and BackOffice software, intended for business use.
